references.paper_title: Cooperation and reputation dynamics with reinforcement learning
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant to the topic of mixed-motive cooperation in multi-agent reinforcement learning, focusing on reputation mechanisms to incentivize collaboration.

references.paper_title: The mechanics of n-player differentiable games
references.reason: This foundational paper introduces the concept of differentiable games and provides essential theoretical underpinnings for analyzing learning dynamics in multi-agent systems, which is directly relevant to the proposed DMG framework.

This work is highly relevant due to its introduction of opponent-learning awareness, which is directly related to the concept of aligning individual and collective objectives by considering the actions and learning of other agents.

references.paper_title: Social diversity and social preferences in mixed-motive reinforcement learning
references.reason: This paper directly addresses mixed-motive cooperation in multi-agent reinforcement learning, exploring the influence of social preferences and diversity on collaborative behavior, providing valuable insights for understanding the complexities of mixed-motive scenarios.

references.paper_title: Prosocial learning agents solve generalized stag hunts better than selfish ones
references.reason: This paper investigates prosocial behavior in multi-agent systems, showing that prosocial agents outperform purely self-interested ones, which complements the study's focus on aligning individual and collective objectives through altruistic behavior.
